descriptions: Routine i-th of the body (format: 'frequency:pose1.pose2...poseN.'. See all pose codes here.
examples: @12h00:M2Message at midday.A99. -> Tell message 'Lunch!' at 12 every day and put arms up quickly
never:D0. -> Dance 0 never (to disable the routine)
@20h00:Lry.W2.Lrn. -> Turn on RED led at 20h00 for 2 seconds and turn it off
~30m:M1Drink water!. -> Tell to 'Drink water!' every 30 minutes
[smTWtfs]~30mf6t18:M1Water!. -> Tell 'Water!' with font size 1 every 30 minutes from 6 until 18 on Tuesdays and Wednesdays
[SMtwtfs]@15h00:NBaby%eats!. -> Notify 'Baby eats!' at 15h00 on Sundays and Mondays
~10s:L?. -> Turn randomly all leds every 10 seconds

descriptions: Zone to pick up the current date-time from. See here.
Frequency at which the actor will act and perform its duty. See here.
examples: [smTWtfs]~30mf6t18 -> Every 30 minutes from 06h until 18h on Tuesdays and Wednesdays
oneoff    -> Once and go back to previous configuration

descriptions: Name of the event i-th to be used against IFTTT webhook service.
Bitmap of custom image i-th, represented in base 64. See here.
Move pattern i-th: move name, : character, and command to execute.
Frequency at which the device performs a full synchronization with the server (required as the server performs regular cleanup on old records).
Flag telling if deep sleep mode is on (to reduce power consumption).
Flag telling if the LCD shows the logs or not
User response time in ms. The lower this value the more power consumption.
examples: 1000 -> 1 second of response timelogs in LCD on

descriptions: Determines which first moves will be executed randomly on button press. For instance, if set to 2, only moves 0 and 1 will be executed randomly.
